instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..

threads.title: 820--3332 board power not working with battery!!!
threads.message:
good known battery, good known tested keyboard, <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> re soldered, working good,

board had slight liquid damage , cleaned now , when power connected computer turned on all good, , with battery only, power button does not work,

<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> goes low when i press power button, any idea what could be wrong?


after turns if disconnect power it works all good with battery,   ONLY PROBLEM IT WONT TURN ON WITH BATTERY ONLY

threads.title: 820--3332 board power not working with battery!!!
threads.message:
Battery recognized under OSX?
Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage on charger only (no battery).

threads.title: 820--3332 board power not working with battery!!!
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 52436"]Battery recognized under OSX?
Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage on charger only (no battery).[/QUOTE]

yes battery working perfectly, i also tried with good know battery, 
ppbus 12.59v

threads.title: 820--3332 board power not working with battery!!!
threads.message:
So battery is recognized under OSX and even charging?
Please reply correctly to the questions.

Also, do NOT quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above; maintain forum aesthetic.

threads.title: 820--3332 board power not working with battery!!!
threads.message: yes battery recognised charge and everything i can see under osx,    when macbook turns on i can remove charger it will work with battery,   also i tried with known good battery same result.... both battery charge and work, i can see under osx .

threads.title: 820--3332 board power not working with battery!!!
threads.message:
Please reply with new thread, insted of a comment.
Is more easy to follow the thread.

Check if <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> reacts (drop pulse) when trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> signal; use <RESISTOR>R5015</RESISTOR>/16 pads, instead of power button.
To test on battery only (no charger), of course.

threads.title: 820--3332 board power not working with battery!!!
threads.message:
battery only test result, using <RESISTOR>R5015</RESISTOR>/16 pad does NOT work , also <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> goes down when triggered
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> signal

threads.title: 820--3332 board power not working with battery!!!
threads.message: also i notice if i turn on mac then disconnect power and run with batter ,,, then i press power button for .001 sec it shuts off , when  it run battery it shuts off right way as soon as i press power button

threads.title: 820--3332 board power not working with battery!!!
threads.message: If <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> reacts, then (ALL) <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SX_L</SIGNAL> signals should pulse, at least; check that.
